Introduction
This topic contains information on examinations for undiagnosed illness and MUCMI, including
when an examination is necessary in claims for undiagnosed illness and MUCMI
when to request a Gulf War general medical examination
exceptions to ordering a Gulf War general medical examination
Gulf War general medical examination and finality
impact of known clinical diagnoses on whether a Gulf War examination is necessary
example: Gulf War examination necessary with known clinical diagnosis
example:  Gulf War examination not necessary with known clinical diagnosis
example:  Gulf War examination is necessary with possible clinical diagnosis
Gulf War examination unnecessary when the claim is substantiated
example 1:  examination is unnecessary because claim is substantiated
example 2:  examination is unnecessary because claim is substantiated
Gulf War examination unnecessary – no potential 38 U.S.C. 1117 entitlement
example:  examination unnecessary – no potential 38 U.S.C. 1117 or other entitlement
undiagnosed illness and MUCMI examination procedures
examination requirement for MUCMIs
, and
reviewing examiner’s determination of disability pattern
.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section B - Developing Presumptive Service Connection (SC) Claims from Persian Gulf Veterans
citation: Part VIII, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section B
